title: Video: John Maus – Believer
content:
In the build-up to his newest album, ‘We Must Become The Pitiless Censors Of Ourselves’, John Maus has released a video to the Jackie Chan inspired track, ‘Believer.

’

Watch the video over at Pitchfork TV

Maus lives in his birthplace of Austin, Minnesota, composing synth century songs whilst studying a PhD in Political Science. Drowned in Sound describe his music a “melancholic fantasy” that “affirms that we are all truly alive.” I’d have to agree, if there’s one thing universally accepted about John Maus, he’s definitely unique.

Here’s the cover art and track listing for ‘We Must Become The Pitiless Censors Of Ourselves.’ The album is slated to be released through Upset The Rhythm on June 27th in UK, Europe, Australia and Japan and via their new imprint Ribbon Music in North America on June 28th.

Tracklisting

01. Streetlight
02. Quantum Leap
03. … And The Rain
04. Hey Moon
05. Keep Pushing On
06. The Crucifix
07. Head for the Country
08. Cop Killer
09. Matter of Fact
10. We Can Break Through
11. Believer

For the latest information on John Maus check out the official mauspace
